column4: EpiPen shortages seen in Canada  UK but U.S. supply intact
column5: NEW YORK Mylan N.V.'s  emergency allergy antidote EpiPen is in short supply in Canada and Britain  but remains available in the United States  the treatment's manufacturer said on Friday.

column4: Weibo to ban gay  violent content from platform
column5: SHANGHAI China's Sina Weibo will remove gay and violent content  including pictures  cartoons and text posts  during a three-month clean-up campaign  the microblogging platform said.

column4: Weibo to ban gay  violent content from platform
column5: SHANGHAI  April 14 China's Sina Weibo will remove gay and violent content  including pictures  cartoons and text posts  during a three-month clean-up campaign  the microblogging platform said.

column4: Musk insists Tesla does not need more capital  predicts profit soon
column5: Tesla Inc  will be profitable in the third and fourth quarters of this year and will not have to raise any money from investors  billionaire Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Friday  driving shares in the electric carmaker higher.

column4: U.S. radio host and conspiracy theorist Art Bell dead at 72
column5: U.S. radio host Art Bell  known for his discussions of conspiracy theories and paranormal phenomena during his popular syndicated show "Coast to Coast AM"  has died at his home in Nevada aged 72  the local sheriff's office said.

column4: U.S. radio host and conspiracy theorist Art Bell dead at 72
column5: April 14 U.S. radio host Art Bell  known for his discussions of conspiracy theories and paranormal phenomena during his popular syndicated show "Coast to Coast AM"  has died at his home in Nevada aged 72  the local sheriff's office said.

column4: EU could expand ban to poultry from Brazil's BRF - report
column5: SAO PAULO The European Union is likely to expand a ban on poultry imports  processed by Brazil's BRF SA   the world's largest chicken exporter  according to a local newspaper report on Saturday.

column4: Chevron greenlights Gorgon LNG expansion off west Australian coast
column5: SYDNEY Chevron Corp will proceed with the second stage of its giant Gorgon liquefied natural gas (LNG) export plant off the northwest coast of Western Australia  the company said on Saturday.

column4: Chevron greenlights Gorgon LNG expansion off west Australian coast
column5: SYDNEY  April 14 Chevron Corp will proceed with the second stage of its giant Gorgon liquefied natural gas (LNG) export plant off the northwest coast of Western Australia  the company said on Saturday.

column4: Proxy adviser ISS recommends against five Equifax directors over cyberbreach
column5: April 14 Proxy adviser Institutional Shareholder Services on Saturday recommended investors vote against the re-election of five Equifax Inc directors who served on the company's audit and technology committees prior to a 2017 data breach.

column4: French Mirage  Rafale jets and frigates involved in Syria strikes: source
column5: PARIS French Mirage and Rafale fighter jets were involved in air strikes on Syria together with four frigate warships  a presidency source said on Saturday.

column4: Canada looks into complaints by Tim Hortons franchisees
column5: OTTAWA The Canadian government is looking into complaints that Restaurant Brands International   is not meeting the terms set out by Ottawa when it allowed the takeover of coffee and doughnut chain Tim Hortons  a government spokesman said on Friday.

column4: Activist fund SVM takes stake in Italy's TIM  backs Elliott
column5: ROME  April 14 German activist fund Shareholder Value Management said on Saturday it had built a stake of more than 1 pct in Telecom Italia and supported moves by Elliott Advisers to shake up the Italian phone company.
